resources.string: "It looks like you\'ve put yourself in too much trouble."
I can show you a solution.

This is Ciro
" (\__/) 
 ( '.')
 c(")(")" 


Ciro must move every boulder
" 00000 
 0000000
 00000 " 

on a target
" \ / 
 |- X -|
 / \ " 


When a boulder is on a target, it looks like that 
" 00000 
 0- X -0
 00000 " 

When every boulder is on a target, the level is won. And Ciro looks happy.
" (\___/)
 (=^.^=)
 (") (")" 


Ciro is a smart bunny. Using the menu, you can ask him if it is still possible to win from the current position. 

If it is possible, Ciro can even show you a solution. 

The level selection in the menu will remember which levels you already finished. It will appear in a different color and it will mark the best number of moves you did to win. 

But if you asked Ciro to guide you towards the solution, the level will not be marked as solved. You will have to finish the level all by yourself.
